title: Random Veigar buff idea: Steerable W
body:
I was trying to think of ways to make Veigar stronger while still maintaining Counterplay, and had an idea. 

When first starting LoL, I played Veigar because he was damn funny and he felt powerful. Obviously I was not playing him very well, but one of my favorite parts of his kit was using his W to poke in lane-you know, like nobody past level 10 does because anyone can dodge it-but since I was so early level a lot of people would not notice the shadow and sound and they'd get hit. I always envisioned it almost like a Looney Tunes anvil falling from the sky. 

Now, in Looney Tunes there's always the recurring gag where they try to step out of the falling anvil (having learned their lesson from last time) and the shadow follows then around until they get hit.

What if, while W were cast, Veigar could re-cast it once to cause it to move in the indicated direction, allowing him to follow people trying to juke and turning a somewhat dull skill (I have to cast when people CANT PHYSICALLY DODGE) into a fun little mini-game (was that a short joke? Maybe) for a champ who's kit is simple enough to accommodate one and not have it be overwhelming. 

TL;DR: Allow Veigar to torment his foes by adding an optional re-cast to his W, causing it to move in the direction of the cursor. That would allow the tiny master of evil a response to jukes and mobility while making sure W isn't TOO reliable.

I just think Veigar is a champ who really needs some good mindgames added into his kit for the counterplay it currently has. Similar to Vel'koz, you want to chain your skills in such a way that an enemy trying to dodge one winds up trapped by the other. That really fits into his aesthetic as well, Veigar is the type to "out-plan" his opponents and he wants to Get Them Right Where He Wants Them.

My issue with your suggestion is that it actually removes some skill from Veigar's kit. He can now mis-cast W and then simply re-aim it to make up for the mistake. I would assume that part of the skill involved in using W is predicting when/where an enemy will be. Your suggestion basically gives him a free do-over for screwing up. While what I have suggested may not wind up being the primary use case it could serve as a crutch for less skilled players to get by.

That means that 99% of Ws thrown out by good Veigar's are just against targets stunned by E-a situation where it can't be dodged.

I know Veigar isn't really in a good spot after last patch, but you have to understand that the only reason he's allowed to have a 1:1AP ration 320 base damage aoe nuke is because it's dodgeable.

And how would allowing the Veigar player to reposition it once make it undodgeable? It still lands in the same AOE, at the same delay, it just gives both players a chance to react to it landing. 

At present it is 100% dodgeable and only lands when the opponent CANNOT move out of the way. That presents no fun for Veigar or his opponent. Making it more reliable is not fun, making it more powerful is not fun, why not make it more versatile instead?

Veigar's kit currently has room for one more interesting mechanic. Most mages have at least one multi-click ability (viktors ult, Heimerdinger turrets and ult, Anivia Q)
I'm really stumped as to why you do not consider the ability to move it at a split second "reliable".

It is, but it's reliability that requires player input rather than simply a delay decrease or AOE increase. Think of it like Anivia being able to activate her Q or Heimerdinger being able to fan his rockets. Only allowing him to do it once means that he can't perfectly follow his opponents movement, only where he thinks they'll end up. 

How do you propose Veigar be increased from a sub-40% winrate?

Have his E give bonuses to his other skills if said enemy is caught inside the cage and/or stunned by cage walls.
E's delay now has a purpose.

It's a good idea, I just like "toolbox" mages like Viktor with an optional combo better than walking wombocombo mages like Annie and brand whose whole kit tends to just be ineffective if not used all at once.

Yeah, I guess Veigar would drift in that direction if his E did that, but the thing is Veigar is already strong with his other spells. The only problem is that there are so many things that other champions can do, either mobile or immobile, just to dodge his abilities, and now his R is the only reliable way to guarantee damage onto another champion.
If they changed the way his W worked, and decreased the fall time, or make it like Kog'Maw's ultimate drop time/speed, or made the range bigger, then it would help with how he now has a skillshot Q, and a delayed E.
If his E gave bonuses to stunning a champion or trapping them, then it would make sense for there to be a delay, because the point of getting stuck is supposed to make you feel like you're going to die.

True, but who feels more fair to fight, Annie or Viktor?

both have powerful single-target damage skills, relatively instant AOEs, basic ability AOE ccs, and high burst ults with a sustained damage component.

The difference is, Annie IS the burst combo. She stuns you then rocks you with a jillion damage and you die usually before the stun is off you. Viktor has delays on his cc, his power transfer is a two-parter where he has to auto you, and he will probably need to follow you with his ult since a little less of the damage is upfront. In return, his kit is a powerful toolkit especially when he starts to upgrade it. He can zone with his field, cut his laser at unexpected angles, remote control his ult to clean up fights, juke away with his speed boost from power transfer. 

With Veigar's Q becoming a skillshot, and his stun getting a delay, I'd rather see him move more towards Viktor than Annie. Having a powerful reliable burst ultimate is absolutely fine, but when I play Veigar now compared to the other mages I like I find myself wishing I had a little bit more to do with his ability focused playstyle. I'd rather have him rewarded for good planning and smart strategy during a teamfight than have him capable of making more bursty big plays.

Yeah, Viktor style would be nice for Veigar, since they both have no actual escapes, and Viktor has interesting ways of using his abilities in an area as opposed to one person.
Veigar kind of needed the reliability of his targeted Q to do harass and farming, but he is more free to move around since he doesn't need an actual target to use his Q.
